name: adn_account_id
desc: Your account ID from which we pulled the data. In some networks, such as Facebook and Google Ads, you may have multiple ad account IDs.

name: adn_account_name
desc: The account name of the campaign, as reported by the ad network (when applicable).

name: instance_id
desc: The targeting (be it country or a specific app) associated with the bid. Some networks refer to this dimension as Line Item or Mediation Group.

name: instance_name
desc: The targeting (be it country or a specific app) associated with the bid. Some networks refer to this dimension as Line Item or Mediation Group.

display_name: Ad MonetizationAd Monetization: Earning revenue by showing ads in your mobile app. Singular can track ad revenue as well as in-app purchase revenue to give you your complete campaign ROI. Learn more  SourceSource: In Singular reporting, a source is an ad network or other third-party platform in which you advertised your product.
name: source
desc: In Ad Monetization Reporting: the name of the monetization network.

display_name: Ad PlacementPlacement: A field in Singular reporting that says where/when the ad was displayed in the website/app (the precise meaning varies between networks). Not to be confused with Ad Placement (which is an Ad Mon-specific dimension). ID
name: ad_placement_id
desc: The placement of the ad within the app (not to be confused with the ad type or the geo). Note that this dimension is given different names in different ad networks.

name: ad_placement_name
desc: The placement of the ad within the app (not to be confused with the ad type or the geo). Note that this dimension is given different names in different ad networks.

name: ad_type_id
desc: The type of the ad, e.g., "banner" or "rewarded video". In other platforms, this may be referred to as the Ad Unit or the Ad Format.

name: ad_type_name
desc: The type of the ad, e.g., "banner" or "rewarded video". In other platforms, this may be referred to as the Ad Unit or the Ad Format.

name: affiliate_id
desc: In cases where there is a third party involved in the campaign, e.g. if the network bought inventory from another platform, or a DSP bought inventory from an exchange, this is the ID of the platform/exchange.

name: affiliate_name
desc: In cases where there is a third party involved in the campaign, e.g. if the network bought inventory from another platform, or a DSP bought inventory from an exchange, this is the name of the platform/exchange.

name: app
desc: The app name as configured in the Apps page.

name: site_public_id
desc: For apps, this is the app's ID in the Apple App Store or Google Play (see What is the difference between an app and an app site?). For websites, this is the website URL.

name: asset_id
desc: "Asset ID" and "Asset Name" apply only to Google Ads UAC (mobile app) campaigns and Facebook Ads AAA campaigns. These campaigns have an additional level of granularity in which a single creative (ad) can contain multiple assets (images, videos, and texts), and each asset has its own name and ID. For more information, see the Google Ads Data Connector Guide and Facebook Data Connector. Note: Due to a Google Ads API limitation, you currently can't see Installs broken down by asset, only by creative.

name: asset_name
desc: "Asset ID" and "Asset Name" apply only to Google Ads UAC (mobile app) campaigns and Facebook Ads AAA campaigns. These campaigns have an additional level of granularity in which a single creative (ad) can contain multiple assets (images, videos, and texts), and each asset has its own name and ID. For more information, see the Google Ads Data Connector Guide and Facebook Data Connector. Note: Due to a Google Ads API limitation, you currently can't see Installs broken down by asset, only by creative.

name: opt_in
desc: A campaign and sub-campaign level dimension that indicates whether the user has consented to Apple's app transparency tracking. This dimension's values are "true" and "false". When we can't determine the value, it defaults to "false". Important: when using this dimension, you will not be able to see cost data.

name: banner_name
desc: The name of the banner that the user clicked before they installed the app. This dimension is only available to Banners customers.

name: bid_amount
desc: The bid amount in your organization's default currency (converted from Original Bid Amount). Note: For Google Ads, Singular only pulls the bid amount for campaigns in which the Bid Type is “Target CPA”. See the Campaign Properties FAQ for more information.

name: bid_strategy
desc: This dimension contains the original data that we pulled from the ad network in order to deduce the Standardized Bid Strategy. See the Campaign Properties FAQ for more information. To see exactly which setting we pull from each network and the logic we use to standardize it, see Campaign Properties Data Mapping.

name: bid_type
desc: This dimension contains the original data that we pulled from the ad network in order to deduce the Standardized Bid Type. See the Campaign Properties FAQ for more information. To see exactly which setting we pull from each network and the logic we use to standardize it, see Campaign Properties Data Mapping.

name: unified_campaign_id
desc: The ID of the campaign (see Campaign Name for more information).

name: unified_campaign_name
desc: The name of the campaign. Usually this is pulled from the ad network, but if it's missing in the ad network, the dimension reflects the campaign name reported by the attribution tracker.

name: campaign_objective
desc: For ad networks that distinguish between the campaign objective and the bid type, such as Facebook and Snapchat, this dimension contains the campaign objective. You can also use it to find out if this is a mobile app install campaign. To see exactly which setting we pull from each network to populate this dimension, see Campaign Properties Data Mapping.

name: campaign_status
desc: Is the campaign live or not? Note that this is not a standardized dimension, so it may contain different values based on the ad network, e.g. “live/not live” vs. “true/false”.

name: adn_campaign_url
desc: The URL that is triggered when a user clicks on a campaign ad (the tracking link URL), as reported by the network. See also: Final URL.

name: city_field
desc: The user's city, as reported by the tracker, or else by certain ad networks. Not available for creative reports.

name: adn_click_type
desc: The click type as reported by the ad network, where applicable.

name: conversion_type
desc: How the user interacted with the ad. Possible values: "Click-through" (an ad click) or "View-through" (an ad impression).

display_name: Conversion ValueConversion Value: A single number between 0 and 63 included in an SKAdNetwork postback. The conversion value is the only way to get any information about an install and the user's post-install activity in the SKAdNetwork framework. Learn more
name: skan_conversion_value
desc: The SKAdNetwork conversion value (a number between 0 and 63).

name: skan_conversion_value_description
desc: A summary of the meaning of the conversion value in the context of the conversion model defined for the campaign.

name: country_field
desc: The user's country, as reported by the network or derived from the network's targeting settings. For example, in SKAdNetwork, the user's country is not provided, but sometimes Singular can fill in that information by looking at the network's targeting settings and seeing that the campaign was targeted to one country only.

name: ad_country
desc: The country in which the ad was served.

name: creative_format
desc: The format of the creative as defined by the ad network. This dimension gives more detailed information than Normalized Creative Type. Currently available for Vungle, AppLovin, Unity, and IronSource campaigns. The expected values are: For Vungle: "dynamic interstitial", "square dynamic interstitial", "showcase", "looping", "carousel", "gradient", "swipe" For AppLovin: "GRAPHIC", "VIDEO", "REWARD" (rewarded video), "PLAY" (playable ad) For Ironsource: “Video & Carousel”, “Video & Full Screen”, “Video & Interactive End Card”, “Playable”, “Interactive Video”

name: creative_height
desc: The height of an image/video creative, in pixels.

name: creative_id
desc: The unique identifier of the creative.

name: creative_name
desc: The name of the creative, usually given by the customer.

name: creative_reported_url
desc: The URL that is triggered when the user clicks the creative.

name: creative_width
desc: The width of an image/video creative, in pixels.

name: device_model
desc: In Aura campaigns only: the device model the ad was displayed in, e.g., LM-X320.

name: dma_id_field
desc: The ID of the Designated Marketing Area that the ad was targeted to. The availability of this dimension depends on the network. Not available for creative reports.

name: dma_name_field
desc: The name of the Designated Marketing Area that the ad was targeted to. The availability of this dimension depends on the network. Not available for creative reports.

name: fb_adset_id
desc: In Facebook campaigns only: the "Ad Set ID" given by Facebook.

name: fb_campaign_id
desc: In Facebook campaigns only: the campaign ID given by Facebook.

name: min_roas
desc: For Facebook campaigns in which the campaign objective was set to Lowest Cost with Min ROAS (rather than having a set bid amount in dollars), we store the minimum ROAS percent in this dimension. The Bid Amount dimension for these campaigns will be empty.

name: final_url
desc: In Google Ads (AdWords) campaigns, this field contains the tracking link arguments (suffixes), as they are not included in the Campaign URL reported by Google.

name: installer_source
desc: The raw value of the package or applications that installed the app.

name: is_uac
desc: In Google Ads (AdWords) campaigns only: is the campaign a "Universal App Campaign" (see Google's documentation for more information).

name: keyword
desc: In search results ad campaigns: the search keyword as reported by the ad network. Applicable to Apple Search Ads, Bing, Google Ads (AdWords), Yahoo, etc.

name: keyword_id
desc: The internal ID given by the ad network to the targeted search keyword.

name: keyword_match_type
desc: The matching strategy for search keywords, such as "broad" or "exact" phrase

name: adn_campaign_id
desc: The ID of the campaign, as pulled from the ad network.

name: adn_campaign_name
desc: The name of the campaign, as pulled from the ad network.

name: adn_creative_id
desc: The creative ID as reported by the ad network.

name: adn_creative_name
desc: The creative name as reported by the ad network.

name: adn_sub_campaign_id
desc: The ID of the sub-campaign, as pulled from the ad network. A sub-campaign is Singular's name for an additional grouping of ads that some networks have under the campaign level. Some networks may call it "ad group" or "ad set".

name: adn_sub_campaign_name
desc: The name of the sub-campaign, as pulled from the ad network. A sub-campaign is Singular's name for an additional grouping of ads that some networks have under the campaign level. Some networks may call it "ad group" or "ad set".

name: creative_type
desc: See the Creative Format dimension. Notes: This dimension was formerly named "Creative Type" in the web UI.

name: install_app_store
desc: Names of the app store and applications that installed the app, i.e. iOS App Store, Google Play, Samsung Galaxy Store, Xiaomi, Huawei, etc. Derived and standardized from the 'Install Source' dimension.

name: original_bid_amount
desc: The bid amount in the original currency.

name: original_ metadata_currency
desc: The original currency of the bid (see Original Bid Amount).

name: adn_original_currency
desc: The original currency as reported by the ad network. This may be different from the default currency set up for you in Singular.

name: os
desc: The operating system of the marketed product. For an app, this usually indicates which app store the app is sold in, e.g., "iOS" or "Android".

name: placement
desc: # Where or when the ad is displayed in the website or app (the precise meaning varies between networks). Currently available for Facebook, Twitter, and Snapchat. Not to be confused with Ad Placement, which is an Ad Mon-specific dimension. Note: This network-only dimension will cause Joining_Network_and_Tracker_Data" target="_self">network data and tracker data to appear in separate rows. The value of Placement is mapped from different networks as follows: Facebook: • Field: device_platforms/ publisher_platforms/ facebook_positions/ instagram_positions/ audience_network_positions/ messenger_positions • Possible values: mobile, desktop, facebook, instagram, messenger, audience_network, feed, right_hand_column, instant_article, marketplace, video_feeds, search stream, story, explore, classic, instream_video, rewarded_video, messenger_home, sponsored_messages Twitter: • Field: placements • Possible values: ALL_ON_TWITTER, PUBLISHER_NETWORK, TWITTER_PROFILE, TWITTER_SEARCH, TWITTER_TIMELINE, TAP_BANNER, TAP_FULL, TAP_FULL_LANDSCAPE, TAP_NATIVE, TAP_MRECT Snapchat: • Field: snapchat_positions (placement_v2) • Possible values: INTERSTITIAL_USER, INTERSTITIAL_CONTENT, INSTREAM, FEED, CAMERA, GAMES, AUDIENCE_EXTENSION

name: platform
desc: The platform of the marketed product, e.g., "iPhone" or "iPad".

name: publisher_id
desc: The hashed ID of the publisher (app) in which the ad has been displayed.

name: publisher_site_id
desc: The public ID of the publisher (app) in which the ad has been displayed. This field is only populated if this information is provided by the ad network.

name: publisher_site_name
desc: The name of the publisher (app) in which the ad has been displayed. This field is only populated if this information is provided by the ad network.

display_name: Quality ScoreQuality Score: A field in Singular reporting that contains the rating for the quality of ad content and landing pages, as compared to advertisers. Learn more in the Metrics and Dimensions Glossary
name: quality_score
desc: A rating for the relevance of ad content, and landing pages, provided by Google Ads (AdWords) and Bing. The value is 1-10 with 10 being the best score. The higher the quality, the more relevant and useful the ad/landing page is to someone searching for that keyword, compared to other advertisers. See also: Google Ads Help: About Quality Score Microsoft: Quality Score - Definition Microsoft: Quality Score and Quality Impact in Depth Note: This network-only dimension will cause network data and tracker data to appear in separate rows.

name: region_field
desc: The user's geographic region, as reported by the tracker, or else by certain ad networks. Not available for creative reports.

name: skan_redownloads
desc: Apple's SKAdNetwork postbacks include a "redownload" field. According to Apple, this is set to true if the app has already been downloaded and installed by the same user (same Apple ID). Singular marks every SKAdNetwork install accordingly as either a "download" or a "redownload."

display_name: RetargetingRetargeting: A type of mobile marketing campaign that targets existing users of an app/website and aims to get them to re-engage with the product. Learn more
name: retention
desc: Whether the campaign is a retargeting campaign (Yes/No).

display_name: SKANSKAN: Singular's SKAdNetwork solution, offering smart conversion value management that can be configured through the Singular app. Learn more  App ID
name: skan_app_id
desc: The value of the 'app-id' parameter in Apple's SKAdNetwork postback.

name: skan_campaign_id
desc: The value of the 'campaign-id' parameter in Apple's SKAdNetwork postback.

name: skan_network_id
desc: The value of the 'ad-network-id' parameter in Apple's SKAdNetwork postback.

name: skan_publisher_id
desc: The value of the 'source-app-id' parameter in Apple's SKAdNetwork postback.

name: source
desc: The name of the data source (usually the ad network).

name: standardized_bid_strategy
desc: The bid strategy for the campaign: Manual: A fixed bid you determined in advance, e.g. $7 per install or $8 per action. Target: Bidding based on a target bid amount, e.g. $7 CPI, as used in Facebook and Google Ads. Max: Bidding based on a maximum bid amount (e.g. in Facebook when your choice is “Lowest Cost with Bid Cap”). If this is your Standardized Bid Strategy, the Bid Amount represents the maximum amount you were willing to pay. Auto: Automatic bidding (e.g. in Facebook when your choice is “Lowest Cost without Cap”). If the Standardized Bid Strategy is Auto, the Bid Amount dimension is going to be empty.

name: standardized_bid_type
desc: The method by which the bid is set up: ROI (ROAS), CPM, CPC, CPI, CPA, or CPCV.

name: adn_status
desc: The campaign status (enabled/disabled) as reported by the network (when applicable).

name: adn_subadnetwork
desc: The sub ad network, as reported by the ad network. This is an additional level of hierarchy that some networks have. E.g., Google Ads has YouTube, Shopping, etc.

name: sub_campaign_id
desc: The sub-campaign ID (when applicable). A sub-campaign is Singular's name for an additional grouping of ads that some networks have under the campaign level. Some networks may call it "ad group" or "ad set".

name: sub_campaign_name
desc: The sub-campaign name (when applicable). A sub-campaign is Singular's name for an additional grouping of ads that some networks have under the campaign level. Some networks may call it "ad group" or "ad set".

name: creative_text
desc: The text associated with the creative (the creative may or may not have other elements associated with it, such as an image or a video).

name: tracking_url
desc: In Google Ads (AdWords) campaigns, each ad click triggers two separate URLs: a destination (e.g. the advertiser's store) and a tracking URL. This field contains the tracking URL.

name: tracker_campaign_id
desc: The campaign ID as pulled from the tracker.

name: tracker_campaign_name
desc: The campaign name as pulled from the tracker.

name: tracker_creative_id
desc: The creative ID as reported by the tracker.

name: tracker_creative_name
desc: The creative name as reported by the tracker.

name: tracker_name
desc: The name configured in the attribution tracker's platform for the tracking link.

name: tracker_source_name
desc: The name of the ad network, as pulled from the tracker. May be slightly different than the Source field (which holds the network name as it's listed in Singular).

name: tracker_sub_campaign_id
desc: The ID of the sub campaign (ad group/ad set), as pulled from the tracker.

name: tracker_sub_campaign_ name
desc: The name of the sub campaign (ad group/ad set), as pulled from the tracker.

name: adn_utc_offset
desc: The timezone offset of the campaign data, relative to UTC.

name: utm_campaign
desc: A specific product promotion or strategic campaign.

name: utm_content
desc: The specific target clicked to bring the user to the site, such as text link or banner ad.

name: utm_medium
desc: The type of link used, such as CPC or email.

name: utm_source
desc: The site that sent the traffic.

name: utm_term
desc: Search terms used to find the site.

name: skan_validated
desc: As a part of Singular's SKAdNetwork solution, Singular not only receives and parses SKAdNetwork postbacks from ad networks but also checks with Apple to confirm that each postback represents an actual install. Validation ensures that installs are not fraudulent.

name: admon_data_source
desc: The source of data for ad revenue. This dimension is useful if you are using more than one method of pulling ad revenue ROI data (learn about the available methods) and want to get the metrics broken down by source. Notes: - To get the name of the ad revenue metric, query the Cohort_Metrics_Endpoint">Cohort Metrics endpoint. - admon_data_source is only available in the API. If you are running reports in the Singular web app, see How can I tell where my ad revenue data is taken from?

name: creative_hash
desc: The calculated MD5 hash for the creative.

name: creative_is_video
desc: True if the creative is a video, false otherwise.

name: creative_url
desc: The URL of the creative (or ad).

name: creative_image_hash
desc: The calculated MD5 hash specifically for the image (in contrast with creative_hash, which is a hash for the entire contents of any creative, including text).

name: data_connector_id
desc: The ID of the data connector through which the data was pulled. Note on "data connector" vs. "source": In Singular, a "source" is an ad network partner from which Singular pulls your advertising data. A "data connector" is a tool that connects to an ad network and pulls data. You may have multiple data connectors sharing the same source. This means they pull data into Singular from the same platform (but with different account names, settings, etc.).

name: data_connector_source_name
desc: The ad network that the data connector pulled data from.

name: data_connector_timestamp_utc
desc: The date and time in which Singular started pulling data from the network. This tells you how fresh the data is.

name: singular_campaign_id
desc: The campaign ID in Singular. This may be different from the original campaign ID - for example, if there are duplicates.

name: singular_creative_id
desc: An identifier given by Singular to the creative. This may be different from the original ID pulled from the ad network or the tracker (for example, if there are duplicates).
Average revenue from ad monetization per daily active user.
Average revenue from ad monetization per user.

name: ad_clicks
desc: The number of times a user clicked on an ad.

name: ad_impressions
desc: How many times ads were viewed in your app (as reported by the network). This includes both videos and static ads.

name: ad_requests
desc: How many times your app contacted the network requesting an ad to display.

name: ad_revenue
desc: The aggregated revenue reported by the network.
Average revenue per daily active user.
Average revenue per user.

name: frequency
desc: The average number of times each person saw your ad.

name: bid_requests
desc: The number of requests by the publisher to open an auction. Currently only applicable to Facebook’s RTB.

name: bid_responses
desc: The number of bids responded to by the auction, i.e. the bid payload for each bid. Currently only applicable to Facebook’s RTB.

name: custom_clicks
desc: Number of ad clicks. By default, this metric is pulled from the tracker side, but it can be set up to show clicks reported by the ad network.

name: skan_report_network_clicks
desc: Clicks as reported by the ad network

name: clicks_discrepancy
desc: The difference between clicks reported by the tracker and clicks reported by the network. Use this metric to help you identify and troubleshoot major discrepancies. Formula: Tracker Clicks - Network Clicks

name: adn_comments
desc: Number of ad comments as reported by the ad network.
Percentage of videos that were viewed in their entirety out of videos that were initiated. Formula: (Completed Video Views / Video Views) * 100

name: completed_video_views
desc: How many videos were viewed in their entirety.

name: ad_completed_video_views
desc: How many users viewed a video in its entirety. Note that not all networks provide this information.
Percentage of videos that were viewed in their entirety out of videos that were initiated. Formula: (Completed Video Views / Video Views) * 100

name: skan_conversion_values_count
desc: The number of SKAN installs for which Singular has received a conversion value (including conversion value 0 but not including conversion value Null).

The percentage of SKAN installs for which Singular has received a conversion value (including conversion value 0 but not including conversion value Null). This is equal to Conversion Values Count / SKAN Installs.

name: adn_cost
desc: Cost (ad spend) reported by the ad network, in your default currency configured in Singular.
Click-through rate (ratio of clicks to impressions).
Conversion rate (ratio of installs to clicks).

name: daily_active_users
desc: Daily Active Users: Number of unique users who had at least one session in the day. The day is the rolling day since the user's time of attribution. For periods of more than one day, the DAU is the average of the daily active users for the selected days.
Effective Cost per Click: the total cost divided by the total click count.
Effective cost per completed view. Formula: Revenue / Completed Video Views
Effective Cost per Install: the total cost divided by the total install count.
Effective Cost per Install, but based on the original cost, before any currency conversions.
Effective Cost per Mille: the cost per 1000 impressions.
Effective cost per one thousand impressions.
Effective cost per view. Formula: Revenue / Video Views

name: adn_estimated_total_conversions
desc: An estimate of total conversions as reported by the ad network (when available).

name: skan_estimated_revenue
desc: Revenue from campaigns that use a Revenue-type model. Update (April 2022): This metric will be deprecated. Use SKAN Revenue instead.

name: skan_estimated_ROI
desc: ROI calculated based on skan_estimated_revenue. Update (April 2022): This metric will be deprecated. Use SKAN ROI instead.

name: filled_ad_requests
desc: How many ads the network served after receiving a request.
Percentage of ad requests that were answered by the network. Formula: (Filled Ad Requests / Ad Requests) * 100

name: custom_impressions
desc: Number of ad views. By default, this metric is pulled from the network side.

name: skan_report_network_impressions
desc: Number of ad views as measured by the ad network.

name: impressions_discrepancy
desc: The difference between impressions reported by the tracker and impressions reported by the network. Use this metric to identify and troubleshoot major discrepancies. Formula: Tracker Impressions - Network Impressions

name: custom_installs
desc: Installs as displayed in the Singular UI. This is a custom field and can be set to show network-side installs for some sources and tracker-side installs for other sources.

name: installs_discrepancy
desc: The difference between installs reported by the tracker and installs reported by the network. Use this metric to help you identify and troubleshoot major discrepancies. Formula: Tracker Installs - Network Installs

name: adn_likes
desc: Number of ad likes as reported by the ad network.

name: adn_clicks
desc: The number of ad clicks as reported by the ad network.

name: adn_impressions
desc: The number of ad views as reported by the ad network.

name: adn_installs
desc: The number of app installs as reported by the ad network.

name: new_visitors
desc: The number of users who've visited your site for the first time.
Conversion rate from impressions to installs (the number of installs divided by impressions).

name: adn_original_cost
desc: Original cost (presented in the original currency) reported by the ad network. In API queries, we recommend using this metric only when using the "adn_original_currency" dimension

name: adn_original_currency
desc: The currency of the Original Cost value.

name: original_revenue
desc: If there are any custom calculations applied to the "Revenue" metric in your account, use "Original Revenue" to see the original revenue value as reported by the source.

name: page_follows
desc: Number of new followers generated from ads as reported by the ad network.

name: posts_saved
desc: Number of post saves as reported by the ad network.

name: re_engaged_visitors
desc: The number of users who've been brought back to your site by a re-engagement campaign.

name: tracker_reengagements
desc: Number of re-engaged users.

name: reach
desc: The number of people who saw your ads at least once.

The number of users still active in the app (sending sessions to Singular) after the number of days specified in the cohort period(s). E.g., "Retained Users 7d" - the number of users still active 7 days after the install.

The percentage of users still active in the app (sending sessions to Singular) after the number of days specified in the cohort period(s). E.g., "Retention Rate 7d" - the percentage of users still active 7 days after the install. Equal to the Retained Users for that cohort period divided by the installs.

name: revenue
desc: The revenue gained from the cohort of users in the selected cohort period.
Return on Investment (return on ad spend): the revenue divided by the cost.

name: adn_shares
desc: Number of ad shares as reported by the ad network.
Percentage of ads viewed out of all filled ad requests. Formula: (Impressions / Filled Ad Requests) * 100
Effective Cost per Install: the total cost divided by the number of SKAN installs.

name: skan_installs
desc: Number of installs as reported by SKAdNetwork.
Conversion rate from impressions to SKAN installs.

name: skan_revenue
desc: Any revenue gained from campaigns, regardless of the conversion model used.

name: skan_roi
desc: ROI calculated based on skan_revenue.
The total revenue divided by the number of daily active users.
The total revenue divided by the number of users.

name: total_revenue
desc: The total revenue gained from ad monetization as well as in-app purchases from the cohort of users in the selected cohort period.
Return on Investment: The total revenue divided by the cost.

name: total_web_conversions
desc: Sum of new visitors and re-engaged visitors.

name: tracker_clicks
desc: Clicks reported by the attribution tracker.

name: tracker_installs
desc: Number of installs as reported by the attribution tracker. For SKAdNetwork Reports, these are installs that were attributed by the tracker based on device matching, as opposed to "SKAN Installs", which are based on SKAdNetwork postbacks. See What are tracker installs?

name: video_views
desc: How many videos were initiated. Depending on the network and ad type, this metric may be the same as "ad impressions".

name: ad_video_views
desc: How many videos were initiated. This metric can sometimes be the same as ad impressions. It depends on the network and the ad type.

name: video_views_25pct
desc: The number of impressions where the viewer watched the video to the 25% point. Formula: impressions x video view rate

name: video_views_50pct
desc: The number of impressions where the viewer watched the video to the halfway point. Formula: impressions x video view rate

name: video_views_75pct
desc: The number of impressions where the viewer watched the video to the 75% point. Formula: impressions x video view rate
Percentage of bid responses against the number of requests. Formula: (100 * bid responses / bid requests)
